page.title: 01THE HERMITAGE/CURRIDGE AREA
page.content: Hermitage and Curridge are two villages to the north of the town of Newbury.Although they lie within the Western Corridor they have been only lightly affected by new building development.Hermitage, the larger, is in the process of having a new estate of some 40 houses built. The M4, which skirts the northern edge of the area, has made great changes to communications eg most people work outside the area. The commuter nature of the area is demonstrated by the high cost of housing - typically Â£35,000 to Â£150,000. Most of the land in the area is woodland or farmland. The two main exceptions being the Royal Engineers School of Military Survey, and the Cementation works.
